c:complexType.name: CartesianAxisPanelOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The options documentation class of the cartesian axis panel.
A cartesian axis panel can referred to in several ways, in order of precedence:
By id the id of the axis is its type followed by it's index (when >= 2) (ex: base, ortho, base2, ortho2, ...)
By oriented id the oriented id of the axis is its orientation followed by it's index (when >= 2) (ex: x, y, x2, y2, ...)
By legacy name
in the special case of the bar chart, the second axes may be referred to by the (now deprecated) names secondX and secondY
By scale type
the scale type can be discrete or continuous and, in the later case, with lower precedence, numeric and timeSeries are also possible
By catch all name the name axis matches any cartesian axis
These names apply equally to the prefixes used to build extension point names.
Which of the names is used depends on which better selects the axes for the properties being specified. If a property should only be applied to vertical axes, independently of the chart's orientation, the oriented id should be used. If, otherwise, a property should only be applied to the base axis, whether or not it is horizontally aligned, then the normal id should be used. If, a property should only apply to continuous axes, the scale type should be used.
For more information on options that are specific to only certain scale types, please see one of the following sub-classes:

c:property.name: position
c:property.c:documentation:
The position of the panel.
The position of the axis is constrained by

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the panel.

c:complexType.name: CartesianAxisPanelExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the cartesian axis panel.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
panel property name (ex: xAxis)
extension property (ex: label)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: textStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: xAxisLabel_textStyle (see ).

c:property.name: ticksPanel
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the tick panel.
One tick panel contains one tick rule and one label. It can be used to conveniently hide all the elements of a tick simultaneously.

c:property.name: ticks
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of a major tick rule mark.

c:property.name: minorTicks
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of a minor tick rule mark. (only for continuous axes)

c:property.name: label
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the tick label mark.
